name: eltopss
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0)), wss(c1, c2))

stmt.origin: adantl(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0), wss(c1, c2))
stmt.pretty: adantl(c0 ∈ Top, c1 ∈ c0, c1 ⊆ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0)), wss(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c1, c0), wss(c1, c2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0)), wss(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c1, c0), wss(c1, c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c1, c0), wss(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c1, c0), wss(c1, cuni(c0)))
-| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0)), wss(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c1, c0), wss(c1, cuni(c0)))
-| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))

|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, c0)), wss(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cuni(c0))

comment: A member of a topology is a subset of its underlying set. (Contributed by NM, 12-Sep-2006.)
